priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Laboratory Animal Species Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C77808

self.title: CDISC SEND Laboratory Animal Species Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the common name for an animal used as the test system in a study (e.g., dog, monkey, mouse, rabbit, rat).
name: Species
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Laboratory Animal Species Terminology

terms.definition: Multiple species of large terrestrial monkeys in the genus Papio, including P. hamadryas, P. papio, P. anubis, P. cynocephalus and P. ursinus.
The domesticated ungulates, Bos primigenius taurus and Bos primigenius indicus.
The domestic cat, Felis catus. (NCI)
The common domestic fowl, Gallus gallus. (NCI)
The anthropoid ape, Pan troglodytes.
A member of the Chinchillidae family of crepuscular rodents.
The domestic dog, Canis familiaris. (NCI)
The common domestic mammal, Mustela putorious.
Any jawed or jawless organisms in the phylum Chordata including the jawless fish, armored fish, cartilaginous fish, ray-finned fish and lobe-finned fish.
An amphibian in the order Anura, which includes the toads. (NCI)
Any of the small mammals belonging to the Gerbillinae subfamily.
Any one of several species in the genus Capra, most commonly Capra hircus.
The domesticated guinea pig, Cavia porcellus. (NCI)
Any member of the subfamily cricetinae and the genuses Mesocricetus, Phodopus, Cricetus, Cricetulus, Allocricetulus, Cansumys and Tscherskia.
The domestic horse, Equus caballus. (NCI)
The common marmoset, Callithrix jacchus.
A genus of rodent in the family muridae.

Any haplorhine primate not belonging to the family Tarsiidae, Hylobatidae, Pongidae, or Hominidae; this does not correspond to any taxon. This group is divided into Old World monkeys (Cercopithecidae) and New World monkeys (Callitrichidae and Cebidae).
Any of numerous species of small rodents belonging to the genus Mus and various related genera of the family Muridae. (NCI)
The domestic pig Sus scrofa domestica. (NCI)
A member of the Columbidae family of birds, most commonly referring to the species Columba livia.
A member of the Phasianidae family of pheasants that includes several genera, including Cotumix, Anurophasis, Perdicula and Ophrysia.
Various members of the family Leporidae, especially those of the genus Sylvilagus. (NCI)
Any of numerous species of rodents belonging to the genus Rattus and/or various related genera of the family Muridae.
Any one of several species in the genus Ovis, most commonly Ovis aries.
